bug.author: taoleicn
bug.summary: Torchscript compilation breaks when `projection_size` is set
bug.description:
Reported by Josh Shapiro (<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jshapiro-asapp>@jshapiro-asapp</denchmark-link> ) <denchmark-code>RuntimeError: Arguments for call are not valid.
The following variants are available: aten::mm.out(Tensor self, Tensor mat2, *, Tensor(a!) out) -> (Tensor(a!)): Expected a value of type 'Tensor' for argument 'mat2' but instead found type 'Optional[Tensor]'. aten::mm(Tensor self, Tensor mat2) -> (Tensor): Expected a value of type 'Tensor' for argument 'mat2' but instead found type 'Optional[Tensor]'.
The original call is: x = input if input.dim() == 2 else input.contiguous().view(-1, self.input_size) if self.weight_proj is not None: x_projected = x.mm(self.weight_proj) ~~~~ <--- HERE U = x_projected.mm(self.weight) else: </denchmark-code>
